title: You should probably put your reading glasses on. . .
text:
Why does society frown on Poly? I realize that there is no one simple answer. Obviously theistic and political powers are at least partially responsible. Tragedy associated with polygamy in popular media certainly has not helped, I'm sure the average person does not bother discerning between the various Poly definitions.

What I find a little sad is how accepting society is of cheating. Sure, cheating is frowned upon; but it is never all that surprising when someone cheats, is it? Cheating is popularized in every form of entertainment that society consumes. Whether you have friends that cheat, you have been cheated on, or you yourself have cheated on someone else, we all seem to have a personal connection to cheating in some way. Cheating is "normal"; it's a part of life. We dismiss "cheaters" as whores, dicks, liars ect. . . But in reality, it surprises no one, and society as a whole seems fairly entertained by it.

Why is sleeping with another person, via lying and betrayal socially acceptable; while sleeping with another person through open and honest communication so perverse?

I think I get it, humans desire control, and monogamy provides a structure for the illusion of control. I call it an illusion because we are never actually in control of another person. Even here on CL, almost every supposedly "open minded" couple posting a mw4w ad is already making demands, and attempting to control someone whom they have not even met yet!!

I don't ever want to be in control of anyone. I prefer embracing the chaos of human nature, guided by openness and acceptance based on the connection you have with another human being, and NOT that person's ability to conform to whatever fantasy some bored husband and wife have dreamed up..

I am looking for someone, and so is my partner. But not "all or nothing" as a couple, rather as individuals who have our own say about how and who we connect with. No long list of criteria, how about we just have a conversation and see where it goes.

I'm not talking about being miserable, too many people are miserable in this world and I don't want any more of them in my life.

You can be happily married or in a relationship and yet still yearn for that feeling of butterflies, excitement, and thrill of new love.

This question is for women who are either married or attached/in a relationship.

Do women, who are in happy healthy relationships, have needs beyond that relationship? What I mean is, can a women be happily married or in a long term relationship, and yet still have needs that don't get met?

It seems to me that most ads (from males and females) that are from people who are attached in some way almost always come down to someone who is unhappy and looking for sex. Makes sense, and I am not judging anyone here.

title: A Poem...
text:
I am in search of a very unique and inspired soul. Above anything else, she has always known that her life calling was to play a critical role in a conscious evolution, an enlightening revolution. A peaceful transition, into the next chapter, while simultaneously by passing any lingering disasters. She may be a goddess, she may be a siren, she might be a singer, or she might be an artist, she could be a prophet, or she could be a sinner. She might be an angel, she might be a devil, but at the end of the day she has a burning desire to take things higher. . .

Me? I am a bit of an anomaly myself, as you may have already gathered. I am forever looking forward and into the light, but I embrace the darkness, as I fight the good fight. I am a steward, I am an idealist, I am a warrior, and a catalyst, and most times a realist. I dream and I dream and I write and I write, some days I am higher then a kite. Sometimes I almost drown, I go into the depths and have a glimpse of a frown. But there is always that burning light I see through those ominous trees, and it somehow always brings me to my knees. It is the divine, the sublime, it is what gets me through the darkest of times.

In a perfect world she would have the luxury to fly like a bird, or to roll down the road like a rolling stone. She would share the passion to wake the sleeping ones from their unconscious slumber and onward to revolution we would lumber. She would sooth and she would caress, she would simultaneously seduce I must confess. . . She would smile into my eyes, as those passions slowly arise. . . As we sit next to that crackling fire, as the energy takes us higher. . .

I know you are out there, you have been waiting for someone just like me. . . Together we shall dance through life, so happily. . .

title: Dating
text:
15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating 
A parody from the other side
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), . They do say you'll find the One (there is no "one" there are the many) 
1. Girls who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. You are notches on the non-existent bed pole.

2. When you find out she already has a boyfriend /girlfriend. And likes the attention, drama. Or wants to watch.

3. When your friend meets his soul mate after being on OK Cupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and he finds the supermodel with 2 PhD's on the online dating without even having a photo up?!

4. When her "friend" invites you to tag along after meeting at the club or bar and expects you to pay for all.
5. When hers idea of a date is bringing her entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. 

6. When you think it's going well and she freak out because you have video games, watch sports, and Anime.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Twice. Poor negotiation and listening skills result in disappointment. Dating is just too much work. FWB is superior.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. 

9. The unsolicited hot crotch pic(or breasts) possibly false advertising.

10. Your real friends will practice "tough love" and force you back out asap. Just like getting back on the horse(or motorcycle) that threw you.

11. Coffee dates. Why wast time and money to find the there is no communication. Spark can be instant (rare) or take time (much more likely). Instant lust is rather rare except in Romance novels and Porn.

12. When she looks nothing like her picture(taken by a professional photographer). The question is, do you call her on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap? She showed only her face the 350lb body was well hidden

13. Dishonest communication where she promises the world. The reality is she wants a free meal and free drinks. So she does not come back from the bathroom

14. Finding out that she is racist , misanderist, sociopathic, a thief and is married to an axe murderer.

15. I don't look like David Beckham nor have his money. In my defense I am not married either.

title: To the woman who is invisible
text:
The story is played out in ads on Craigslist thousands of times a day. Most you'll find in the casual encounters section. Yes, men on this type of quest are a cent a thousand. No one bends over to pick up a penny. Perhaps I can convince you that I am the pearl that awaits you on the shore. 

I did for a moment consider posting this in "casual encounters" but after reflection realized that I don't belong in "casual encounters." What I seek is very very far from casual. I'm seeking an enduring passionate affair. 

Let's get past the preliminaries. Of course there's nothing unique about a married man seeking a woman for carnal pursuits. I claim no distinction there. 

What might be unique is that I'm seeking a very special long term monogamous relationship with a woman for reasons beyond carnal conquest. There is no thirst for me in quantity but there is a great thirst for quality. And there is consummate patience in my quest. 

I am seeking that feeling of wholeness that I once had... most importantly I desire pursuits of the mind, the heart, the soul. If I can find that then I surely know that the body will follow willingly and completely. This is a pursuit of mutual trust and a journey that I wish to be enduring. This is not a cry for a single encounter. 

She knows who she is. She may be trapped in circumstances of necessary commitment, but she is a woman invisible, unfulfilled and unappreciated. She stares in the mirror in the morning wondering what she is doing differently to not be noticed. 

She rifles through her closet baffled why the magic that some of these more enticing garments used to achieve has now dissipated. She mediates yet another loud argument at the dinner table over something so trivial but cosmically consequential and thus becomes the villain in the play. 

She falls asleep at night next to warmth and breathing, longing to be touched and cared for and desired the way she was just a blink of an eye turned into an eternity ago. 

I know her well because I am her male counterpart. Tell me your tale and you have written mine. 

I know you - I've seen you in my fantasies. You are attractive, sensual, open, adventurous, playful, and most importantly intelligent. And although you have agonized over the potential guilt the decision to read my ad has brought you, you are open to a nontraditional-nonpossessive- nondrama arrangement with an attentive, caring, and giving gentleman who will treat you with kindness, adoration, civility, and fill the emptiness in your being. 

Who are you? You are of no particular age, body style or ethnicity. You do however have a positive outlook, the desire to be wanted and needed. You live for the anticipation, the craving and adoration that you richly deserve, and you in return so sweetly give all of that willingly in return. 

Who am I? I'm safe, sane, attractive, very attentive and I love to please. I'm a romantic, a sentimentalist, a conversationalist, a good listener, but most importantly I can be a friend. Physically I am athletically built, blue eyes and have a beguiling smile. I'm bright, professional, well educated, patient, contemplative, in great physical shape, caring, considerate, kind, and I love to please a woman who loves to be pleased. 

If you haven't guessed it by now, this is not an offer for just any woman. It's an offer for a very special woman. I know it will appeal to few and my search has potential to be a long and frustrating one. But I can wait! And I do hope you will find me eventually.
